qas.question: What modem was available for the Japanese SNES?
What service did the Satellaview connect to?
When did the Satellaview begin operation?
When did the Satellaview end operation?
What was the US equivalent of Satellaview?
When did dial-up stop broadcasting in the US?
When did Satellaview start broadcasting in the US?

plausible_answers.text: download gaming news and specially designed games

qas.question: What did users of XBAND do in Japan?
What did an XBAND attach to on consoles in Japan?

plausible_answers.text: remakes of or sequels to older Famicom titles

qas.question: What kind of games were downloaded on XBAND  to compete in Japan?

context: Japan saw the release of the <a0_0>Satellaview<a0_0/>, a modem which attached to <b8_0>the Super Famicom's expansion port<b8_0/> and connected to <a1_0>the St.GIGA satellite radio station<a1_0/>. Users of the Satellaview could <b7_0>download gaming news and specially designed games<b7_0/>, which were frequently either <b9_0>remakes of or sequels to older Famicom titles<b9_0/>, released in installments. Satellaview signals were broadcast from <a2_0><b6_0>April 23, 1995<b6_0/><a2_0/> through <a3_0><b5_0>June 30, 2000<b5_0/><a3_0/>. In the United States, the similar but relatively short-lived <a4_0>XBAND<a4_0/> allowed users to connect to a network via a dial-up modem to compete against other players around the country.
